Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

This section provides answers to common questions about installation, usage, troubleshooting, algorithms, and contributions to CasaNova.

General Questions

Q1. What is CasaNova? CasaNova is a financial-based personalized housing recommendation system. It calculates realistic housing budgets using DSR-like logic and recommends properties based on lifestyle preferences and infrastructure accessibility.

Q2. Who is the target user? Users in their 20s seeking affordable housing options and wanting transparent, data-driven financial analysis.

Installation & Setup

Q3. I installed the backend, but the server won’t start. What should I check? Verify the following:

  1. .env file exists and contains valid credentials

  2. MySQL server is running

  3. Migrations have been applied:

python manage.py migrate

Q4. Frontend cannot connect to the API. What should I do? Ensure:

VITE_API_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/

Then restart Vite:

npm run dev

Q5. Do I need MySQL to run the project? Yes. CasaNova uses MySQL for stable relational data management. SQLite is not recommended due to dataset size.

Financial Simulation

Q6. How does CasaNova calculate my maximum loan amount? CasaNova applies a PMT-based formula considering:

  • monthly income

  • DSR ratio

  • loan interest rate

  • loan tenure

Result:

max_loan = available_monthly * (1 - (1+r)^(-n)) / r

Q7. Why do some loan products show 0 eligibility? Possible reasons:

  • Income is below product’s minimum requirement

  • Credit score is too low

  • Preferential benefits do not apply

Q8. Can I change the DSR ratio? Yes. The frontend allows adjusting DSR ratio settings. Developers can modify backend defaults in settings.py.

Property Recommendation

Q9. Why is the recommended property list empty? Common reasons:

  • Budget too low

  • Incorrect CSV dataset

  • Missing columns: 위도, 경도, 물건금액(만원), 주소, 건물명

Q10. What is the Infrastructure Score? A weighted score calculated from:

  • Park distance

  • School distance

  • Mart distance

  • Transport access

CasaNova assigns scores (30–100) based on travel time.

Q11. Can I customize the preference weights? Yes. Users can adjust weights in the UI. The backend also allows default values to be modified:

weights = [5, 4, 3, 2]

Datasets

Q12. What datasets does CasaNova use? The system requires infrastructure datasets for:

  • parks

  • schools

  • marts

  • metro/bus stations

  • real estate property listings

Q13. Where should dataset files be stored? Place them in:

data/

Modify paths in the backend if necessary.

API & Development

Q14. Does CasaNova support public APIs? Yes. Endpoints include:

  • financial analysis

  • loan recommendation

  • property recommendation

Full details in the API Reference.

Q15. How do I test backend functions manually? Use Django shell:

python manage.py shell

Then import functions such as:

from engine.loan import recommend_loans

Q16. Is authentication required? Not yet. Future versions may include JWT-based authentication.

Contributing

Q17. How do I submit a contribution? 1. Fork the repo 2. Create a feature branch 3. Commit changes using the contribution guidelines 4. Submit a Pull Request 5. Obtain 2 approvals

Q18. What is the branch naming format?

type/issue-number-short-description

Examples:

  • feat/12-add-financial-engine

  • fix/30-dsr-calculation-bug

Licensing

Q19. Can I use CasaNova in commercial projects? Yes. The project is licensed under Apache License 2.0, which permits modification, distribution, and commercial use.

Q20. Do I need to provide attribution? Yes. Apache 2.0 requires preservation of copyright notices.

End of FAQ
